claude-3-haiku-20240307.patternDescription: The correct answer to this puzzle involves a combination of grid splitting and pattern repetition. The input grid is split into a 2x3 grid, and then the pattern of the original input is repeated across each of the 6 resulting sub-grids.

claude-sonnet-4-20250514.patternDescription: The aliens are showing us a grid doubling and overlay transformation. They take the original pattern, double its width by placing two copies side by side, then double its height by stacking two copies vertically. Finally, they fill empty spaces with a checkerboard pattern of peace symbols (‚ô•) while preserving the original human symbols (üë§).

Now fill all the empty spaces (‚¨õ) with a checkerboard pattern using peace symbols (‚ô•), but keep all the human symbols (üë§) exactly where they are. 5. The checkerboard starts with ‚ô• in the top-left empty position and alternates from there.

claude-sonnet-4-20250514.alienMeaning: The aliens seem to be showing us a message of peaceful coexistence and expansion.
